main event: A bright, circular object approximately 50-60 feet in diameter was observed in the sky over Dunkirk, New York for around 10 minutes before rapidly accelerating and departing the area.
interesting points: The object was described as emitting a bright glow.
The sighting was investigated by personnel from the 544th Air Defense Group, New York Air National Guard, who found no evidence of a conventional aircraft or other explainable phenomenon.
The witness was considered a credible observer with no known history of false or exaggerated reporting.
The report was forwarded to the Air Force for further evaluation and analysis due to the extended duration of the sighting and the rapid acceleration of the object upon departure.
The Air Force requested the witness complete an ATIC Form 164 to provide more details about the observation.
sighted object: A bright, circular object approximately 50-60 feet in diameter
